title: Random search leads to mass temptation.
content:
While trying to find the name of the antiquarian bookseller that was in our vendor area at TypeCon04 in San Francsico, I went to ever-helpful google and typed the keywords, "san francisco antiquarian books typography type specimens". One of the hits came back from the [ABAA (Antiquarian Booksellers Association of America)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023171320/http:/search.abaa.org/dbp2/catalogues.php?catnr=2266&membernr=1608) and I suddenly found myself thinking about my checking account. Sheesh! Temptation at this hour is not such a good thing.

If anyone _does_ happen to remember the name of the bookseller, please tell me as I'm really struggling to remember.
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content:
Tiff,  
Put the mouse down and back away slowly :-)

ChrisL
:^D The mouse isn't the problem. It's the credit card I have to leave at home.

The mixture of the smell of old books and new plastic can be volatile :-)

ChrisL
